snippet.textDisplay: Nothing to say about the rendition itself. There is some serious errors in caption/description. It's Marfot or Ma'rifat, not Mahawat. Marfotis don't worship idols either. They are a spiritual bunch who seek a connection with God beyond rituals. They respect all religions. It's also not a thing of the past. The rift between Marfoti and Shoriyoti continue to this date in Bangladesh, not sure about West Bengal.
snippet.textOriginal: Nothing to say about the rendition itself. There is some serious errors in caption/description. It's Marfot or Ma'rifat, not Mahawat. Marfotis don't worship idols either. They are a spiritual bunch who seek a connection with God beyond rituals. They respect all religions. It's also not a thing of the past. The rift between Marfoti and Shoriyoti continue to this date in Bangladesh, not sure about West Bengal.

snippet.textDisplay: The people who are contesting the fact that this song doesn't do justice to the Islamic tradition, this is to remind you all that for centuries Allah and Hari have co existed peacefully alongside each other in folk music and narratives for centuries in Bengal. saying that they be separated from each other and be looked at as different trajectories is blasphemy. Doya kore ektu porashona ta korun. :)
snippet.textOriginal: The people who are contesting the fact that this song doesn't do justice to the Islamic tradition, this is to remind you all that for centuries Allah and Hari have co existed peacefully alongside each other in folk music and narratives for centuries in Bengal. saying that they be separated from each other and be looked at as different trajectories is blasphemy. Doya kore ektu porashona ta korun. :)

snippet.textDisplay:
No one with brain wants to disrespect Islam or any other religion. The mistakes in this song are major, but that does not mean the performers or the producer of the song were trying to show disrespect to Islam.......... 

I can bet, give them a hindu stotra, sloka or any song that has Sanskrit in it, they will do the same mistakes, for sure.............. its not about religion, its all about language training.
snippet.textOriginal:
No one with brain wants to disrespect Islam or any other religion. The mistakes in this song are major, but that does not mean the performers or the producer of the song were trying to show disrespect to Islam.......... 

I can bet, give them a hindu stotra, sloka or any song that has Sanskrit in it, they will do the same mistakes, for sure.............. its not about religion, its all about language training.
